page.title: 14Broomhill Flash
page.content: Broomhill Flash is a large pond found on Wombwell Ings. The pond belongs to Wombwell Gun Club. The pond is used by birdwatchers. The pond has one hide that holds 20 people. The pond has many varieties of birds, including Herons,Swans,Great Crested Grebes, Moorhens and Lapwings.These birds are protected and the only birds that can be shot are Teal, Snipe, Mallards and Pigeons.In the centre of the pond there are boxes for the birds to lay eggs. In addition to the birds the Flash houses many kinds of fish. The local people can obtain a fishing permit for Â£20 per annum, with which they can fish for Perch, Roach, Bream, Pike and Eels, however only the Pike and Eels can be kept.
